snippet: A university statement said that Daniel E. Straus, who owns two nursing home companies embroiled in a labor battle, was leaving “by mutual agreement.”
abstract: New York University Law School trustee Daniel E Straus is stepping down; Straus's company had subpoenaed personal emails, texts and diaries of two NYU law students who have supported efforts on campus to draw attention to labor dispute in which Straus is involved.
lead_paragraph: A university statement said that Daniel E. Straus, who owns two nursing home companies embroiled in a labor battle, was leaving “by mutual agreement.”

headline.main: N.Y.U. Law School Trustee Whose Company Subpoenaed Students Is Stepping Down
headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Trustee Leaving Board After Subpoenas
